text: Beyond the Cities is a 1930 British drama film directed by Carlyle Blackwell and starring Blackwell, Edna Best and Alexander Field.Wood p.69 The film was made as a quota quickie for release by Paramount Pictures, and is believed to have been made at Twickenham Studios.Chibnall p.260 The film is mainly set in Canada. It is also known by the alternative title of Reparations. ==Cast== * Carlyle Blackwell as Jim Campbell * Edna Best as Mary Hayes * Alexander Field as Sam * Laurence Hanray as Gregory Hayes * Helen Haye as Amy Hayes * Eric Maturin as Hector Braydon * Percy Parsons as Boss ==References== ==Bibliography== *Chibnall, Steve. Quota Quickies: The Birth of the British 'B' Film. British Film Institute, 2007. *Low, Rachael. Filmmaking in 1930s Britain. George Allen & Unwin, 1985. *Wood, Linda. British Films, 1927–1939. British Film Institute, 1986. ==External links== * Category:1930 films Category:1930 drama films Category:English-language films Category:British films Category:British drama films Category:Films set in Canada Category:Films shot at Twickenham Film Studios Category:Films directed by Carlyle Blackwell Category:British black-and-white films Category:Quota quickies
title: Beyond the Cities
